title: Fed Officials: Now Isn’t the Time for the Fed to Think About Pulling Back Support
sub_head: ‘I see us staying the course for a while,’ Chicago Fed president says
body:
Two Federal Reserve officials said Wednesday there will be no imminent pullback in central bank support for the U.S. economy even with growth likely roaring back this year and the unemployment rate seen falling.
There also is the potential for a temporary rise in inflation over the next few months, but “it will be critical for monetary policy...
